result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael S Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael S Johnson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Continue in AODA Programming. No contact with C.D. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Michael S Johnson in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue  
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Def- Request a signature bond and waive the preliminary hearing. 
St- No objection. Matter was referred to Drug Court.
BTC: $1,000 signature bond. Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
